titleStmt.title: On the south wall of the central shrine, Kārkōṭakēśvara temple (Tirunallūr-Parameśvara temple), Kāmarasavalli, Tiruchirappali district.

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_IdListMembers_v01.xml file.

revisionDesc.change: Updating toward the encoding template v03

div.p: kō-p parakēsaripanmarkku yāṇṭu 9 Āvatu

vaṭakarai brahmatēyam śrīkāmaravalli-caturve
ti-maṅkalattu peruṅkuṟi perumakkaḷōm I
vv-āṭṭai dhaṉu-nāyaṟṟu viyāḻa-k kiḻamai pe
ṟṟa kārttikai-nāṉṟu taṭṭaḻi-koṭṭi peruṅ
kuṟi cāṟṟi

maṇṭakattē kūṭi Eḻu=ntaruḷi Iru
n=tu nam tirunallūr parameśvarkku can=trātit
tavaṟ śrīpaliyum tiruppaḷḷi Eḻucciyum koḷ
vataṟku peruṅkuṟi perumakkaḷōm vaittu-k ku
ṭutta jivitam āvatu

śrīkotaṇṭarāma-vāykkā
l-k kiḻ nirpūci nel viḷaiyum nilam ellām
virivu māttāl tūṇi-p patakku nel

Aṇaik
ku vaitta nellilē māttāl kuṟuṇi nel
pūttōṟum koḷḷa-p peṟuvat’ āka

Av Avva āṇ
ṭu Ūrvāriyam ceyyum perumakkaḷē terica
tt’ oppu puka Iṭakkaṭavarākavum

rippiṉpaṭi tēvakaṉmikaḷ kaṉali
taṇṭikoḷḷa-p peṟuvār ākavum

I
-p paricu Innel koṇṭu can=trātit
tavaṟ śrībali koṭṭuvataṟk’ āka

pa
ṇi-p paṇiyāl nālu ceriyilum
nallūr haṭṭaṉ nakkanākaṉ paṇi
yālum kaṭavūr nārāyaṇaṉ nārayaṇa
ṉ

paṇiyālum komaṭattu tiṟrukkuṟuṅ
kuṭi-k kramavittaṉ paṇiyālum kirāñci
kkam pattipoḻ nārāyaṇahaṭṭa
ṉ

paṇiyālum Ipparicu can=trāti-t tava
ṟ niṟppat'āka śilālekhai ceytukuṭut
tōm peruṅkuṟi perumakkaḷōm

paṇi
yāl madhyastaṉ Amaṇa
maṅkalayaṉāṉ nūṟṟu
vaṉ muṉṉūṟṟuva
ṉen Ivai-y eṉne
ḻuttu

Ippaṭi paṇi
yāl madhyastaṉ brahmapiri
yanṉ eṉ

Ippaṭi paṇi
yāl marutūr peruṇkāli
tiyāṉa pūtaṉ śrīkaṇṭa
neṉ

Ippaṭi paṇiyāl madhyasta
ṉ Ecu Ippaṭi Aṟiveṉ
neṉ

Ippaṭi paṇiyāl ma
dhyastaṉ tiruveḷḷarai pe
ruṇkālitiyāna
9th year of the king Parakēsaripanma.

We, the great people of the assembly peruṅkuṟi perumakkaḷōm of the Śrī-Kāmaravalli-caturvetimaṅkalam, a brahmadēyam on the north [of something?]. After having the drum beaten taṭṭaḻi-koṭṭi on the auspicious day of Kārttikai–which happened this year on a Thursday of the Dhanu month– the assembly proclaimed the following

We, the great people of the assembly peruṅkuṟi perumakkaḷōm gathered up in the maṇṭapa maṇṭakattē kūṭi, have granted vaittu-k kuṭutta an allowance jivitam for the maintenance of the holy procession śrīpali and the ritual of waking up of the Lord tiruppaḷḷi eḻucci –as long as the sun and the moon endure– for our god Tirunallūr Parameśvara gracefully has taken abode consisting of āvatu:
a patakku of paddy and a tūṇi for each mā extending virivu to all land that grows rice with holy water? nirpūci to the east of the holy śrī Kotaṇṭarāma channel.
one kuṟuṇi of paddy for each mā in case the paddy is attached to the embankment aṇai.
a daily tōṟum supply peṟuvatāka of flowers.
In the same way avvava as the assembly perumakaḷ, the village commitee ūrvāriyam will act so that the managers of lands iṭakkaṭavar do the collection of taxes? on each new moon for a year.
so that there are people in charge of peṟuvār collecting taxes fire of the temple administrators tēvakaṉmikaḷ according to paṭi .
so that the service of beating of the drums koṭṭuvataṟku in śrībali happens, as long as the sun and the moon endure, taking this paddy in this way ipparicu:
through the service of Haṭṭaṉ Nakkanākaṉ from Nallūr in all the many residencies
through the service of Nārayaṇaṉ Nārayaṇaṉ from Kaṭavūr
through the service of Tirukkuṟuṅkuṭi Kramavittaṉ from Kōmaṭam?
through the service of Pattipōḻ Nārāyaṇahaṭṭaṉ from Kirāñcikkam? through the service of paṇiyāl
We, the great people of the assembly, have had it engraved in stone so that the service is done in this way as long as the sun and moon endure.
through my service paṇiyāl, Madhyastaṉ Amaṇamaṅkalayaṉ, alias ... nūṟṟuvan Muṉṉūṟṟuvaṉ. These are my letters.
Through the service made in this way by Madhyastaṉ Brahmapiriyaṉ.
Through the service made in this way by alias Marutūr Peruṅkālitiyā.
First edited in (SII 19, no. 231); encoded here for DHARMA (ERC n° 809994) by Renato Dávalos; translation by Renato Dávalos and Emmanuel Francis.
